intro: Vernonia yabelloana, commonly known as the Yabelloa Vernonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the dry season. Vernonia yabelloana is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
